result.execSummary:
The defendant Veronica A McDade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 03-01-2016, alternate 5 days in jail, if not paid.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Veronica A McDade

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

ADDRESS INFO for Veronica A McDade

Prior: 2453 N. 25th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
filed by Attorney Martinez

Defendant Veronica A McDade in court with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend to county ordinance theft 13.102(c)(12).  Defendant enters a no contest plea to amended charge.  Court finds Defendant guilty of amended charge and imposes fine of $267.50 - to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 3/1/16, alternate 5 days jail if not paid.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
